title: Sri Lanka bond yields up, rupee bid at 285
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond market remains inactive in mid-day trade on Tuesday (22), brokers said while the rupee is quoted around 285 in bids with no firm offers.
The bond market is not that active because investors are waiting for clear direction, a market broker said.
In the secondary market, the only liquid bond maturing on 01.08.2024 is traded around 14.40 percent and was quoted at 14.35/50 percent in mid-morning trade, up from 14.30/40 percent a day earlier.
Sri Lanka’s debt office is offering 56.5 billion rupees in bills to be sold in an auction to be held on Wednesday.
The bills will be split into 20 billion maturing in 3-months, 15 billion in 6-months and 21.5 billion in 1-year.
In the money market, the central bank was quoting an indicative spot rate of 280.00 dollars, up from 275.00 dollars, a day earlier.
Market participants said the rupee is quoted around 285 in bids with no firm offers.
Commercial banks were offering to sell dollars at 274.99 rupees for telegraphic transfer and buy at 264.66 rupees on Monday.
